Description: Rectangular cover for a mudstone palette: recessed on the underside. The top is very slightly convex and has a handle, now broken, in the approximate centre. On one end of the cover there is an incised inscription of Neitḥotep. Good condition.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Djer, tomb O. 2 or O.3 subsidiary burial
Curator's comments: The object bears an excavator's mark which is originally written as O.2 but altered to O.3. See also 1901,1012.11. The recess was not intended for the palette to fit within the cover, as the mudstone palette found with this object does not do so (1901,1012.11). Probably the recess was made to allow some cosmetic to be kept on the palette when the cover was in place. For similar objects, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.VIA, 6; XXXII, 67; XXXIV, 23; XXXVIII, 2; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Gizeh and Rifeh' (Warminster, 1977), pls.IV, V, 10-12; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ III, (1897-8), pl.XV, 8; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens (Berlin, 1929-31), 11, no. 348 and pl.36; J. E. Quibell, 'Archaic Mastabas' (Cairo, 1923), pl.XI, 6; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 84. no. 79 and pl.102, 79;Compare Z. Y. Saad, 'The excavations at Helwan art and civilization in the first and second Egyptian dynasties' (Norman, 1969) , pl.93; Z. Y. Saad, 'Royal Excavations at Helwan, 1945-7', pl.XXIVb. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 20, 36, pl.II, 11, pl.XXXII, 67; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 212; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 910, n. 1230; A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte [eds.], 'Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo' (Ravenna, 1998), p.240 [211].
